notesStmt.note: Uneven trimming at lower edge and, in part, losses of printing at head.
Dark at edges and outer end (dirt and slight damp mottling).
Usage and rust stains, a smear of green pigment on verso.
One small loss to rodent at outer end.
Binyamin Ze᾿ev ben Yehudah Shtoḳfish and Yosef ben Eli῾ezer Mosheh Ferar (?): inscribed at head.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 31; ruled lines: 18; written lines: 18; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point, membrane by membrane. Visible stiching of membranes. Hair side and flesh side of membranes distinguishable. Three tagin on שעטנזגץ and one on בדהחיפף. A few majuscular or minuscular letters, ח being also arched. The names of the sons of Haman arranged in 11 lines, in accordance with the rule. Wooden roller (155mm high).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian square script of the 17th century.
